text:
A passport for you… for your mom… What do you want with Razumihin? I love you too. Seriously, I love you more than anything. Let me kiss your dress, please. Just the sound of it drives me wild. Tell me to do it, and I will. I’ll do the impossible. Whatever you believe, I’ll believe. I’ll do anything! Just don’t look at me like that. Do you know you’re killing me? 😩

He was losing it. Something snapped in his head. Dounia jumped up and rushed to the door. 

“Open it! Open it!” she yelled, shaking the door. “Is anyone there?”

Svidrigaïlov stood up, shaking off the moment. His lips twisted into a sarcastic smile. 

“No one’s home,” he said calmly. “The landlady’s out, and yelling won’t help. You’re just stressing yourself out.”

“Where’s the key? Open the door now, you coward!” 

“I lost it and can’t find it.”

“This is outrageous!” Dounia gasped, going pale. She dashed to the far corner and quickly barricaded herself with a small table.

She didn’t scream but kept her eyes locked on him, watching every move. Svidrigaïlov stood across the room, looking composed, but his face was still as white as before. The mocking smile lingered.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia confronts Svidrigaïlov in a locked room, feeling threatened and desperate for escape.
